reviews.review: lord forgive me

Honestly this game has gone to shit, valve is an awful company and we should stop acting like they care anymore. The bots are never going to go away and the only person working on it is a monkey inputting random letters and calling them security and stability improvements.

I really enjoyed playing this game 10 years ago back when it was still popular, but now every game I enter it feels like I'm the only human surrounded by bots. All bots run the sniper class and look up no matter what, and will always headshot you. There are also some cases where the bots would use my name as a way to avoid getting banned, and at that point I understood that this game is no longer playable. If there were a couple of bots, then I would understand. However, at this point there are so many bots I have a hard time finding lobbies that have any people in it. 

10 years ago - 10/10 game
now - 1/10 game

Only reason I downloaded this game was for its sentimental value, but now it feels like that's quickly diminishing.

Unplayable at it's current state. Can't find a match that doesn't have bots, scripters, or lag switchers. It's despicable that Valve has let their online service get to this state. Every match I've played today (5 matches this morning), every single one had bots and script kiddies. I managed to find a match full of humans yesterday and everyone was rejoicing about how rare that was. I won't even touch on the fact that workshop creators and Valve are ruining the artstyle and economy of this game due to the piss poor cosmetics they are adding

I hate this game

I love this game, I have over 1k hours in this game, I've installed mods, got into the community, I've sweated, I've 
danced in the servers, I've wasted my money on MvM on various times, I've traded.

I don't think that there will ever be a game that I like more than this one.

And yet, I cannot leave a good review on it, the bot problem is inexcusable. The amount of gymnastics that have to be done to get to a playable server is not logical, or fun process. I don't believe that having playable public, officially supported servers is much to ask from a 10 billion company on a head title.

Что-ж, рано или поздно надо было высказаться.За свою игру на 2 аккунтах в Tf2 я могу рассказать.Когда я впервые увидел записи и геймплей игр людей, видео представление классов и другой весёлый контент по этой игре. Я загорелся поиграть в эту игру. Мои первые игры на классических серверах были освоением в этой игре.Но не смотря на это я горел Tf2,я смотрел  офицальные анимации sfm, неофицальные анимации.Мне нравилось.Я учился,играл,делал первые красивые убийства и серии.Но потом я на некоторое время забросил игру. Вернувшись через время я увидел изменения в лучшую сторону,я был счастлив ведь мне не надо было смотреть список серверов и искать нужный.А потом начались боты. Сначала я думал что с этим справятся valve и не думал что valve забили на tf2. Но через короткое время мнение поменялось. Valve please clean team fortres2 from cheaters and bots.#SAVETF2
I'm MEDIC main and that's it... What else do you want everything... Why do you keep reading this?... That's all

Team Fortress 2 is one of those special games that I came to relatively late; despite this, it will always have a place in my heart: the game mechanics, the flexibility of the classes and subclasses, the charismatic characters, the story and the great community make TF2 one of the most enjoyable and incredible experiences I've ever had in a video game; and even if I'm not as active or as good a player as I would like to be, I know that when I open the game and enter a game I'm guaranteed a good time and a thousand laughs, no other game is so enjoyable even when you are losing the game, and what to say about the friendlies that hasn't been said to exhaustion? They are the representation of what TF2 is, the epitome of a casual game, highly accessible and 101% friendly.

Unfortunately the current state of the game makes it almost impossible to enjoy the game without the need to log into a community server; almost all of them being North American servers, despite this, TF2 is still, and will remain, one of my favorite games of all time.

Highly recommended.

The bots are not as bad as people say. Just be vigilant about removing them.

[h1]Jogo Bom e uma Comunidade Neutra[/h1]

Esse jogo é muito bem feito no tópico Hero-Shooter, Team-Shooter e uma comunidade neutra,
com certeza você vai gastar muitas horas nele, e talvez, esse jogo tem a comunidade menos tóxica entre todos os jogos online do tema Team-Shooter lançados pela Valve.

Qualquer player desse jogo não iria te julgar por causa de seu desempenho na partida vencendo ou perdendo, além de ter uma gameplay boa e também um sistema de micro-transações balanceado que se baseia em itens cosméticos, que você vai esquecer depois de 10 minutos de gameplay.

Atualmente o jogo está sofrendo um ataque de robôs nos Servidores Casuais da Valve, que destroem a gameplay de qualquer um, mas esse é o tipo de coisa que a Valve resolve se os Players pedirem e os Servidores da Comunidade do TF não são afetados pelo mesmo problema, então podemos jogar tranquilamente.

[b]Espero que poste uma análise da sua experiência com o jogo, porque a minha foi ótima desde agora![/b]
